channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024040456
item.description:
Report E-2024040456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged pails, impacted absorbents, and PPE were containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2024040615
item.description:
Report X-2024040615

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-07
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload manager called for a package that was leaking inside the trailer. Upon arrival, a leaking package was found and absorbent powder was placed on the residue. Upon inspection, loose caps were found inside the package along with 0 inner packaging. DescribePack: Loose cap from the pressure of of many bottles of liquid caused the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking package was placed inside a bag with a plastic container. Absorbent powder was poured on the residue or leak on the trailer floor.

item.title: Report E-2024040364
item.description:
Report E-2024040364

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia dock employee was transferring waste containers from a service vehicle to a trailer at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA when he discovered a 5 gallon pail had tipped over and leaked. The container was up righted and overpacked and the small spill was quickly cleaned up. Further investigation revealed the proper closure was not used for the container by the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024040556
item.description:
Report X-2024040556

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a red hazardous bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. It had small wet spots on top of the packaging. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the damages. DescribePack: 1 bottle cap was not completely secured on the bottle and leaked during transit. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was kept upright to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040536
item.description:
Report X-2024040536

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had discoloration on top. It was placed into a red hazmat tote with a liner and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area. DescribePack: The seam near the cap of each plastic container was slightly open, allowing some of the liquid contained inside to leak onto the plastic jugs and onto the cardboard box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a red hazmat tote with a liner

item.title: Report X-2024040524
item.description:
Report X-2024040524

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Nu-Brite condenser coil cleaner one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap causing leakage and allowing .25 gallons to release. package did have slotted partitions but no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle of Nu-Brite and a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5gallon plastic bottles of convoclean forte one 2.5gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25gallons to release each bottle was in a plastic bag but no other slotted partitions or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 2.5gallon plastic bottle of convoclean forte had a loose cap allowing .25gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024040486

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2x 2.5-gallon plastic bottles of convo clean 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of convo clean had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from bottle. Package had plastic bags no slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of convo clean had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040452
item.description:
Report X-2024040452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload, upon inspection one of the two bottles had a loose cap and leaked inside and outside of the package. DescribePack: 1 Gallon bottle had a loose cap, which leaked even though it had a plastic bag on it for extra security. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and taken to QA where it was contained in the QA hazmat cage and processed.

item.title: Report X-2024040448
item.description:
Report X-2024040448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat pkg came down QA01 belt from the unload. Noticed a wet spot on the bottom of the box. I grabbed my PPE and put the damaged hazmat pkg in a red hazardous waste bin for inspection. DescribePack: One of the bottle have a puncture hole on the bottom of the bottle, it was leaking out slowly DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The bottle with the puncture hole on the bottom of the bottle had to be placed upside down to prevent any more liquid leaking out.

item.title: Report X-2024040470

Report X-2024040470

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler found the package while van was being unloaded. Package handler noticed it was wet, alerted manager, and manager brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: The lids appeared ok on both bottles but the body of one bottle was dented. Could not be positive what caused the leak or where it was coming from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bin and brought to Qa.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found by the load side manager. The box had a code 10 on it and it smelled really strong. Upon inspection, one of the bottles cap was loose and its inner seal was broken causing it to leak. DescribePack: the cap was loose and inner seal broken. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024040491
item.description:
Report X-2024040491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS LEAKING IN UNLOAD TRAILER AND GIVEN TO QA. QA OPENED BOX FOR INSEPCTION AND DISCOVERED IT TO BE A LARGE BATTERY. THE BATTERY WAS WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BUT THERE WAS A HOLE IN THE PLASTIC CAUSING THE SPILL TO FUTHER LEAK. DUE TO THE HAZARDOUS NATURE OF A BATTERY THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A SAVAGE DRUM DescribePack: SMALL HOLE IN PLASTIC COVEREING BATTERY. BATTERY ITSELF WAS WET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS SECURED IN DRUM IN THE CAGE

SPILLING HAZMAT WAS CONTAINED IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND HAZMAT PROCEDURES WERE STARTED DescribePack: LID ON 1 OF THE GALLONS WAS LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT PROCEDURE, PLACED IN HAZ TOTE AND PUT IN HAZ CAGE

  • City: LEWISBERRY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer number 565302 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 4 X 1 GALLON OF OLD LIMEY LIME DEPOSIT REMOVER PLASTIC BOTTLES WAS CRUSHED ALLOWING ALL 4 GALLONS TO RELEASE FROM BOTTLES package had no slotted partitions bags or absorbent. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 4 X 1 GALLON OF OLD LIMEY LIME DEPOSIT REMOVER PLASTIC BOTTLES WAS CRUSHED ALLOWING ALL 4 GALLONS TO RELEASE FROM BOTTLES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE

item.description:
Report X-2024040273

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA because it was wet on the bottom. Originally it seemed that something may have spilled on it but upon further inspection, the bottle had a very slight leak. DescribePack: The pail's closures were fine and could not pin point were the puncture was but when placed on a dry surface it became wet over time. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a hazmat bag and pail and kept separate from other boxes.
